bugs.title: CVE-2021-46312 djvulibre: divide by zero in IW44EncodeCodec.cpp

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-46312 djvulibre: divide by zero in IW44EncodeCodec.cpp

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered IW44EncodeCodec.cpp in djvulibre 3.5.28 in allows attackers to cause a denial of service via divide by zero.

Upstream bug:
https://sourceforge.net/p/djvu/bugs/344/

Created djvulibre tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-8 [bug 2234737]
Affects: fedora-38 [bug 2234738]

bugs.title: CVE-2021-46312 djvulibre: divide by zero in IW44EncodeCodec.cpp [epel-8]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-46312 djvulibre: divide by zero in IW44EncodeCodec.cpp [epel-8]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-46312 djvulibre: divide by zero in IW44EncodeCodec.cpp

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered IW44EncodeCodec.cpp in djvulibre 3.5.28 in allows attackers to cause a denial of service via divide by zero.

Upstream bug:
https://sourceforge.net/p/djvu/bugs/344/

Created djvulibre tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-8 [bug 2234737]
Affects: fedora-38 [bug 2234738]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2234736

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2234736,2234737

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
It would be great to get it into EPEL8 if possible.  Marek - are you up for it?

FEDORA-EPEL-2024-f7310355bb (djvulibre-3.5.28-5.el8) has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 8.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-f7310355bb

FEDORA-EPEL-2024-ff0fd23aa7 (djvulibre-3.5.28-4.el9) has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 9.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-ff0fd23aa7
